alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 28 at 2:18PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City UT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Warm temperatures will significantly increase snowmelt leading to increased flows. For the Weber River...including Plain City...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...From Saturday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Friday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached as early as Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 11 AM MDT.
